page.title: 19Working in the Bakery
page.content: My dad makes meringues. He gets up at five and starts work at six. He makes the meringues of egg white and puts them into a tall grey cupboard with closely packed shelves. He puts that into an oven that goes round in a circle to make them more crunchy. He comes home about 3 o'clock and round about tea-time, he goes down, takes them out and leaves them to cool. My dad mends the machines and makes guards for them so nobody gets injured. He has two assistants and his own workshop. There is a new factory being built, so he'll have plenty more machines to mend.
